alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:33PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Adams, northeastern Whitman, eastern Lincoln, southwestern Stevens, southern Ferry and Spokane Counties through 315 PM PDT... At 232 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles northeast of Ritzville to 17 miles northwest of Potlatch. Movement was north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spokane, Spokane Valley, Cheney, Liberty Lake, Airway Heights, Medical Lake, Nine Mile Falls, Millwood, Davenport, Otis Orchards-East Farms, Fairwood, Suncrest, Fairchild AFB, Otis Orchards, Dishman, Green Acres, Trentwood, Country Homes, Town And Country, and Mead. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 234 and 298. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 245 and 298. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 56 and 95. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 165 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
